EmailTemplate.subject: RE: MBO Partners Call Summary (1384815168.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - - 90 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Scott, Please see my answers below in black. Thanks!Sara ___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> We’ve got some serious perks you’re eligible to win when you refer a friend <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program?r=conde> to MBO Partners! Ask me about them. Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Scott Donovan [mailto:scott@fabrixdigital.com] Sent: Monday, November 18, 2013 12:37 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: RE: MBO Partners Call Summary Sara, I am just trying to get feel for how my clients will see this: I am going to market my services under a company called BleuPrint Creative. As clients engage my services, I then introduce MBO as the background entity that handles billing, etc. – If the name “BleuPrint Creative” is for branding purposes only it does not need to be an official legal entity (if you use MBO). Thus, there is no need to create a separate corporate account and tax ID to use this name for marketing. The only thing you may want to consider is a DBA (doing business as) to claim the name so no one else can use it. 1. Does this get confusing with BleuPrint Creative as far as taxes? No, because no money will be flowing under a separate BleuPrint Creative tax ID. The funds will be coming into your MBO account under our W-9 and paid out via a payroll under MBO’s tax ID resulting in a W-2 from MBO. 2. Are the invoices co-branded with BP Creative? If you want them to be absolutely; we can have the BleuPrint Creative name and logo listed on the invoice with the phrase “processed by MBO Partners” underneath it. With this set up the MBO logo would not even appear on the invoice. This is a custom choice that is completely up to you. Thoughts. Suggestions. Scott Donovan FABRIX, inc.231 Foster AvenueCharlotte, NC 28203 704.525.3540 PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL This electronic message and any attachment(s) thereto is intended only for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged, confidential and exempt from disclosure under applicable law. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, or the employee or agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please immediately notify me by telephone at 704.525.3540 or return e-mail and destroy any copies, electronic, paper or otherwise, which you may have of this communication. From: Sara Conde [mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>] Sent: Tuesday, November 12, 2013 3:53 PM To: Scott Donovan (scott@fabrixdigital.com <mailto:scott@fabrixdigital.com>) Subject: MBO Partners Call Summary Dear Scott, It was a pleasure speaking with you today.
